MAST.utility.defect_formation_energy.potential_alignment module¶

class MAST.utility.defect_formation_energy.potential_alignment.PotentialAlignment[source]¶
get_potential_alignment(perfect_info, defect_info)[source]¶

Gets the shift. Assumes all atoms in the perfect cell are symmetry equivalent, i.e. for Sc2O3, by symmetry we have two different Sc atoms (8b and 24d Wycoff positions) with two different potentials.

In reality the best way to do this is to match up the symmetry positions of the perfect with that in the defected and do the alignment that way. However, a quick and dirty way is to average over each symmetry position, which allows us to account for the different symmetry environments in an effective way without having to dig into the underlying unit cell symmetry.

read_outcar(outcar)[source]¶

Reads a VASP OUTCAR file, and extracts out some useful information. Args:

outcar: OUTCAR file name
Returns:
elst_pot: average electrostatic potential for each atomic center atom_list: list of each atom type
